website_summaries.verdict: A small business would do well to consider the affordable APA20, which brings the robustness of 802.11ac to dedicated access points, despite its somewhat fragile antennas.

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless penetration = great coverage
customer_reviews.text: This review is similar to my review for the Amped Wireless RTA15 as I purchased them together and have the same experiences with both After doing extensive research, I decided to purchase the Amped Wireless APA20 Access Point and I am glad I did. I get 10 times the coverage we did prior. In terms of quality and signal strength, this has beat out several other name brands we have tried. This is being used in a large industrial shop and due to the construction of the building (concrete, steel) and the large machines we have, signal strength even directly underneath the router was a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: good, but not as good as expected - UPDATED 8/12/14 DROPPED TO 1 STAR
customer_reviews.text: It is a good access point, but i didn't see much range improvement over my old Linksys wrt54. It is faster due to the new WiFi standards(n,ac) but for nearly $200 i expected more. - - - - - - - -UPDATE 8/12/14 - - - - - - - IT WONT GO A WEEK WITHOUT HAVING TO UNPLUG THE ACCESS POINT FOR 30 SECONDS OR IT WONT CONNECT. FOR SUCH AN EXPENSIVE PIECE OF EQUIPMENT. i AM THE IT MANAGER FOR A FAIRLY LARGE COMPANY WITH MULTIPLE OFFICES AND I WILL NOT BUY ANOTHER AMPED WIRELESS PRODUCT. TO BAD BECASUE THEY SOUD REALLY GOOD IN THE DESCRIPTION, JUST DOESN'T LIVE UP TO IT
customer_reviews.author: N. Berg

customer_reviews.title: huh?
customer_reviews.text: worked about as well as an obama economic stimulus package. i took a sledge hammer to it after a month. i dont have time to waste on junk like this. customer service and tech support was non existent at best. slow, glitchy, dont buy.
customer_reviews.author: fadingbeleifs

customer_reviews.title: Working very good
customer_reviews.text: It has been working great so far, seems very fast although It does not really have a lot of range. I had it on the top floor of my home but 2 levels down I was only getting about 2-3 bars of signal strength on my devices. I ended up moving it to the first lower level and I am getting good signal 2 floors up and 1 floor down. Update, After a couple months, it pooped out. Constantly loosing internet/network and had to be reset almost daily. I ended up scraping it and bought a Linksys brand that has been working exceptionally well.
customer_reviews.author: icybernate

customer_reviews.title: Requires Constant Re-Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I was running 3 of these both at home and at work. The last one I bought in late 2015 has finally gave up requiring constant re-boots. I replaced 2 of the Amped units with NetGear and now I just ordered another NetGear.. Needless to say I'm done with Amped Wireless..
customer_reviews.author: A to Z

customer_reviews.title: Not a Router, its an access point.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is good when you have an ISP that uses a Gateway w/built in router that also controls TV boxes. So those of you with Uverse and Xfinity will be able to get the through put on WiFi that is only guaranteed on the switch without knocking down the phone and TVs. The instructions that come with the unit are pretty good, follow them and you''ll be O.K. For Amazon Bots: I have made this review if the APA20 amped wireless access point; STOP putting reviews on wrong products.
customer_reviews.author: outlawstar100

customer_reviews.title: Nice AP, but it's it hangs sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Nice AP, but it's it hangs sometimes. While the AP continues to work when it hangs, you just simply can no longer login to it -- it just stops responding to login attempts until you power cycle it. I have 3 of these and it has hung on all 3 devices, and with the latest firmware. While it rarely hangs, it's a nuisance to power cycle if it's a hundred miles away. I do like the ability on this AP to set WiFi power, lower power is better in my WiFi congested environment.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Unit
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful, much more than typical retail unit who typically run 200mw. Setup my laptop to static IP, connected cable to Amped unit, set IP to my network, and away it went. Has power settings to adjust your power needs to your location. Been running two weeks with no issues. Not sure about the person below stating that it reset to factory settings when loading firmware....that is what devices do when firmware is loaded. Great product, really pumps out the wireless. I was getting only 10-12 mbps on my middle to higher end cisco wireless router in the same room, with Amped I get my full ISP rate of 100mbps up and down! Great product
customer_reviews.author: eb

customer_reviews.title: Terrible experience don't even think about buying this
customer_reviews.text: What a nightmare experience. The very short version is worked on and off for 14 months then totally failed today. Spent an hour with tech support only to be told its out of warranty, there's nothing they can do and I am screwed then ask me if I would like to buy another one. OMG GRRRRRRR
customer_reviews.author: Jim B.

customer_reviews.title: Loses Connection Often
customer_reviews.text: Although the coverage is good, it loses the connection frequently. The connection is only restored when I cycle the power. I set up a timer to do that automatically during the night, bur that doesn't appear to be often enough. I don't need an AC unit yet, but since I needed an access point, I though it would be a good plan for the future. I considered reprogramming the timer to recycle the power more often, but I think I'll setup an old Linksys N router with DD-WRT as an access point until I need the AC capability. I wasted $180.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fatally flawed right out of the box. Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: Steer clear of this Access Point as it requires frequent reboots to maintain connectivity; I've tried two of them and they both have the same issue. The vendor has a "fix" in the form of a f/w update that allows you to schedule a reboot of the AP to alleviate the dropped connectivity but I hardly call that a fix. And since that update was about a year old at the time I gave up on Amped, I don't expect them to ever fix this. When it worked, it was very good re signal strength and speed, but it never stayed up long enough to be useful. It's too bad, I really wanted to like this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Shipley

customer_reviews.title: it works when it works. really though a company ...
customer_reviews.text: it works when it works. really though a company who does a firmware update to add the feature of automatically rebooting the device at a given time, says something about how the device performs. I find that i have to unplug it a few times. or it just drops the network side. no vlan support. the "massive" 700mw is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Buggy firmware, lack of product support.
customer_reviews.text: There doesn't seem to be very good continued firmware support from Amped Wireless. The current firmware lacks important features and the unit seems a little unstable requiring reboots to resolve connectivity problems. Price is good, and performance (when it's working) is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cascianelli

customer_reviews.title: good coverage for good price
customer_reviews.text: been using Amped Wireless for several customers, so far no issues
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drops Signal Only Works 50% Of The Time
customer_reviews.text: Has never worked correctly from the beginning. The "N" wireless would drop like crazy and have been running the "G" wireless but, it stalls and drops needed to be rebooted about every month. I finally have had enough and purchased a Cisco Small Business router that matches the rest of the equipment in my network.
customer_reviews.author: C. Heitz

customer_reviews.title: Great performer
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the better performing access points I've worked with. I use it in a data center enviornment where 2.4ghz is heavily overloaded and 5ghz is a bit on the busy side as well and I can go a good distance without any issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K. Mertz

customer_reviews.title: Product didn't work well. Would only connect if you ...
customer_reviews.text: Product didn't work well. Would only connect if you are close to the unit. 2 rooms away would ask for password or if connected to wifi signal no internet connection. Firmware is up to date. Called tech support and was on hold For 1 hour which is no big deal if it would of helped, he told me to reinstall firmware and I asked him is there anything else we can try if that doesn't work he said maybe. So i reinstalled firmware and still had same problem so i will be returning it and look for another solution.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K. Poe

customer_reviews.title: Consistently drops connection
customer_reviews.text: It offers great coverage but it drops connection AT LEAST once a day. I tried setting a static IP within the web interface. I set it as a DHCP client and gave it a reservation within my sophos firewall/router, nothing works. It has the latest firmware and is still unreliable. I plan on returning this.
customer_reviews.author: TooTall for Most Things

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems to disconnect randomly.. will investigate further and update review if necessary
customer_reviews.author: Randy Heptner

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: It appears to work good. Some minor drop outs have not been confirmed as to whether it is the unit or the provider.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Completely Unstable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased July 18th and initially worked ok but as time wore on I found my self having to reset this thing daily, then eventually 2-3 times a day. I feel like for a $150 Acess Point, that's completely unacceptable reliability. I eventually found myself having to pause movies I was streaming so I could reset the Access Point after I had reset it before I started streaming in the first place!
customer_reviews.author: TLB8880

customer_reviews.title: Great access point and a good feature set and can ...
customer_reviews.text: Great access point and a good feature set and can cover a lot of area. Make sure you want an access point this is NOT a router.
customer_reviews.author: lothar863

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works ok when it does, but seems to drop out almost daily requiring a reboot to take connections again.
customer_reviews.author: pixelpusher220

customer_reviews.title: 11AC cards to it among other things got a R6300 and put it in access point mode and is working way better
customer_reviews.text: Had issues with connecting intel 802.11AC cards to it among other things got a R6300 and put it in access point mode and is working way better
customer_reviews.author: Jsalz1

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother!
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Tried a replacement of the same product and 2nd one didn't work either. Constantly drops connection to the wireless and needed to be reset multiple times a day. Avoid!!
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: First Class Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: Access point works well, but doesn't have the range I expected. I had some setup connection problems, but thses were resolved with the help of Brian - Concierge #143. he spent 30 minutes and did a great job. Problem was with ISP provided router conflict. Hats off to Brian!
customer_reviews.author: JOHN S. ROYSTER

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews, signal strength and throughput really no different than other models.
customer_reviews.text: Don't make a mistake, read the reviews, don't waste your time and money. I should have. The power and signal strength of this AP is no different than something as simple and inexpensive as a Linksys (Cisco) WAP610N, albeit the Amped does have the simulataneous 2.4 and 5ghz (most people don't need this) and it is ac (so?). And yes, tech support, in case you read this, we did speak on the phone and I upgraged the firmware, and did all the settings correctly.The issue here is it does extend the range, sure, but the signal strength and throughput drop quicker than a much less expensive model, so what is the point?
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Once configured the product greatly extended the WI-FI range in my house. Not the easiest to setup but I called Ryan at customer service and he patiently worked thru the configuration until the system worked. Now that it is up and running it is dependable and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: easy like 1-2-3
customer_reviews.text: setting up the device was simple, I own 4 of them and i have not had any issues with any of them.
customer_reviews.author: Marvinjm

customer_reviews.title: Needs constant restarting
customer_reviews.text: Constantly needs to be restarted and drops signal for no apparent reason.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Unstable WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Constant drops even with new firmware on two different units. Daily reboots required. Skip these as not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: wifi drops for no reason
customer_reviews.text: I'm really disappointed after my purchase. This access point has some nice features but I have it sitting on my desk and the wifi constantly drops.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Luis Manners

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not only is the product excellent, but the technical support was top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Richter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ricardo was a huge helping me with installing this product
customer_reviews.author: Mona M.

customer_reviews.title: AP is ok, but not the big improvement I expected.
customer_reviews.text: The APA20 is an ok Access Point. Not sure it is worth the BIG extra bucks... It was easy to setup, no issues whats so ever. The power is not as extravagant as advertised. And yes I put the correct antennas on the correct numbered post. :-) Luckily for me it helped just enough with a couple of trouble spots for my wireless cameras. I can't seem to add a video at this time but I have a photo which is worth 1000 words. As you can see 3db better than my Cisco Router. Gadget
customer_reviews.author: Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Issues.  Not recommended, beware
customer_reviews.text: Reappeared failures of the device, probably firmware issues. Had it replaced by manufacturer, same issues with second unit, finally was able to return for refund by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Steve Conceirge #109 is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this product and it worked great. Just wasn't what I needed. I needed an access point with wifi and not an extender. Steve was able to access my situation and point me in the right direction. If you want to talk to Americans and don't like deal with computerized voice systems then this is the company. They have great products that work and good English speaking people to talk to here in America. Thanks again Steve for all you help.
customer_reviews.author: Louisiana Liquidator

customer_reviews.title: Avoid, connection drops constantly and without reason. (this ...
customer_reviews.text: Avoid, connection drops constantly and without reason. (this is my second one that has done this) I've adjusted every setting there is and rebooted it constantly, still drops all connections. I gave up on it and turned off wifi on my phones and just use cell towers. Looking for replacement product now for my computers.
customer_reviews.author: Muddy

customer_reviews.title: Amped
customer_reviews.text: The APA20 solved all the wifi problems we were having in our home. Setup was pretty straightforward, I am not tech savvy and I expected this to be more challenging. Fair price for good device. I needed customer service when I purchased another smartphone and I forgot the wifi password. Amped's tech support's phone number was easily found on their website. After a few minute's on hold, Sam, from tech support, took my call. He was exceptionally patient and talked me through the entire process to get all our devices - 2 laptops, 2 iPads, 2 smartphones - operating on wifi. I am not used to that level of tech sport that Sam provided. Great device, great customer support.
customer_reviews.author: arnold chassen

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit few minor quirks.
customer_reviews.text: I've decided to change my review due to a new discovery I've made. the drop out issues I've had are apart of a bug in my netgear d6300 modem/router firmware. the unit is fantastic with a very long range for both Wi-Fi bands, the set up is quite easy, exception being a few reboot required to adjust some settings. the speeds are the best my devices can achieve. Its a great all round unit that does what it promises. The APA20 is the only true access point on the ac band and does not require custom firmware to get it to function as an access point.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Dolezal

customer_reviews.title: Amped Wireless, Your Product is incredible, solving are problem with low signal internet!
customer_reviews.text: I want to thank the support team to bring my issues to a total repair. The advice and meticulous trouble shooting by Jason was priceless. John and I, Terry, followed his step by step explanations that even a not techy could follow the help to resolve all the problems. 5 stars may be too low a rating. Quality patience and care was we received, also a call handled prior with a cell phone disconnect on our part, (Bad cell phone area), the representative, and sorry I didn't get his name. Thank You, again Terry and John.
customer_reviews.author: Terry And John

customer_reviews.title: A worthy and solid access point
customer_reviews.text: Brought this in as an improvement over the Amped AP20000G. It has a little more power and the coverage is just a little better. We are running both our internal network and a guest network on it. Seems to work well and no one has complained of dropped connections or an inability to connect. I'm not sure the upgrade was significant over the Amped AP20000G, but it's way better coverage than the Netgear WNDAP350 access points we were using before.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Miller

customer_reviews.title: He guided me through a very thorough process and determined rather quickly that the problem I had connecting to the internet was
customer_reviews.text: My technician, Patrick, was FABULOUS!!! He was patient, listening carefully to my dilemma. He guided me through a very thorough process and determined rather quickly that the problem I had connecting to the internet was related to a poor internet outlet. As soon as I plugged this device in to another outlet, it was up and running perfectly!! Thanks so much, Patrick!! I am very grateful!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: It proved to be very easy to use this Access Point device with easy manual ...
customer_reviews.text: #181 was very helpful. I was able to succeed in my password reset thanks to representative 181. It proved to be very easy to use this Access Point device with easy manual download off their website.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Ackerman

customer_reviews.title: Cra-Po-La
customer_reviews.text: Unstable, needs frequent resetting. Save your money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: SamL

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable to the point of uselessness
customer_reviews.text: Extremely unreliable, needs to be power-cycled on a semi-regular basis. Has a way of just freezing up, even with the latest firmware update. I gave up on using it as my primary access point after a few frustrating months.
customer_reviews.author: Viet-tam Luu

customer_reviews.title: and Sam from Amped did a great job in helping me resolve the problem
customer_reviews.text: Had a problem resetting my AP, and Sam from Amped did a great job in helping me resolve the problem quickly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Amped Wireless High Power 700mW Dual Band AC Wi-Fi Access Point (APA20)
product_meta.description:
See how the APA20 worksView larger INSTANTLY ADD LONG RANGE, ULTRA-FAST 802.11AC WI-FI TO ANY EXISTING NETWORK
The Amped Wireless High Power 700mW Dual Band AC Wi-Fi Access Point adds long range, ultra-fast Wi-Fi access to any existing wired network or networks with older wireless technology. Whether you are streaming HD movies onto multiple devices, knocking out the competition on your online gaming platform, downloading new music, or powering an entire office of computers - this Access Point can handle it. The APA20 attaches to an available ethernet port on your router/network and automatically configures itself to your network settings without any additional setup or software. It's powered by Amped Wireless' High Power Technology and is equipped with ten amplifiers (two 2.4GHz amplifiers, four 5.0GHz amplifiers, and four low noise amplifiers) as well as three high gain antennas. The APA20 is also built with advanced 2-stage, 5GHz amplifiers that boost Wi-Fi signals twice for maximum range. And with the power of 802.11ac Wi-Fi technology, it provides Wi-Fi speeds up to three times faster than 802.11n. Unleash your laptops, tablets, smartphones, and e-readers in more places throughout your home, backyard, or office with the most powerful Wi-Fi Access Point available. Note: The APA20 is NOT a router. It is a High Power Wi-Fi Access Point that attaches to your existing router.

THE AMPED WIRELESS DIFFERENCE
At Amped Wireless we do things differently. We build best-in-class products with industry leading technology and stand by every product we produce with superior customer service. We focus on high power, well performing Wi-Fi in order to give our customers the best wireless experience available. We know that the best wireless experience doesn't end at High Power technology and that is why we have Elite Support, our in-house U.S. based support team. Our Elite Support team is knowledgeable, passionate, and ready to answer your questions, 7 days a week. Top of the line technology, High Power products, and superior customer service - that is The Amped Wireless Difference.

FREE WI-FI ANALYTICS TOOL MOBILE APP (ANDROID & WINDOWS)
The Amped Wireless Wi-Fi Analytics Tool helps you to analyze and optimize your Wi-Fi network, to allow for maximum speed and coverage. The app is free to download and compatible with Android devices as well as Windows PCs. Download it today and get the most out of your wireless network.


Learn more about High Power vs. standard Wi-Fi productsView larger HIGH POWER VS STANDARD WI-FI PRODUCTS
All Amped Wireless products feature advanced amplifiers and high gain antennas to provide more Wi-Fi coverage compared to standard Wi-Fi devices. The APA20 features up to 700mW of output power and 5dBi antenna gain. That’s over 14x more output power than standard devices. In addition, standard Wi-Fi devices typically use internal antennas while the APA20 features three external, detachable antennas to provide a better signal.

Uncover our High Power technologyView larger LONG RANGE WITH HIGH POWER TECHNOLOGY
Bring more range to your network and eliminate Wi-Fi dead spots with the APA20's High Power technology. The APA20 is equipped with a total of ten amplifiers (two 2.4GHz amplifiers, four 5.0GHz amplifiers, and four low noise amplifiers) as well as three high gain antennas to provide high performance Wi-Fi coverage. Similar to the way a twin turbo works for a sports car to provide more power, the APA20 features advanced 2-Stage Amplifiers that boost your Wi-Fi signal twice to achieve maximum range.

4 Gigabit Ports & a USB Port - see for yourselfView larger CONNECT MORE DEVICES & SHARE FILES EASIER
Seamlessly connect your printer, computer, server, hard drive, and other network devices with ease. The APA20 provides four additional gigabit network ports for connecting even more wired computers, A/V devices, and other devices at ultra-fast gigabit wired speeds. It also has a built-in USB port for easy file sharing via a USB drive or USB hard drive. A detachable desktop stand is included and doubles as a cable organizer.

Grasp the difference in Wi-Fi speedsView larger ULTRA-FAST 802.11AC WI-FI SPEEDS
Enjoy your HD video streaming and wireless gaming on multiple devices, simultaneously, with next generation 802.11ac Wi-Fi technology. The latest technology, 802.11ac, provides Wi-Fi speeds up to three times faster than 802.11n. The APA20 is capable of providing 300Mbps for 2.4GHz connections and up to 867Mbps for 5.0GHz connections simultaneously.

Setup couldn't be more simple - learn hereView larger SIMPLE PLUG-AND-PLAY SETUP
Getting started is as easy as plugging it in! The APA20 features true plug-and-play setup to have you up and running faster. Simply connect the APA20 to your router's network port and it will automatically configure itself to your network without any additional setup or software. Connect to the Access Point with a wired or wireless device and you're done.

Find the Access Point that you needView larger FIND THE ACCESS POINT THAT'S RIGHT FOR YOU
Amped Wireless has a full line of Access Points to cover your Wi-Fi needs. Every single one is built with Amped Wireless' High Power Technology, but their power and purposes vary. Find the solution that fits the size of your home or office, the amount of power you need, and the number of ports that will best serve your network.
feature_bullets: Extend Wi-Fi coverage up to 8,000 sq. ft. throughout your home, backyard, and office
Get better Wi-Fi coverage with ten high power amplifiers and three high gain antennas
Enjoy fast HD streaming and lag-free gaming with next generation, ultra-fast AC1200 Wi-Fi speeds
Connect more computers, printers, & other network devices with 4 Gigabit wired ports
Share files easier with a built-in USB port
Starting is easy with simple plug & play setup

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars72 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
